Simulated Survival Data Set

Source: R/sim.R
sim.Rd

A data frame containing simulated survival times, censoring indicators, and covariates for use in survival analysis.

Usage

sim

Format

A data frame with variables:

id

Observation ID.

time

Observed survival time.

status

Event indicator (1 = event, 0 = censored).

x1

Standard normal covariate.

x2

Normal covariate, correlated 0.3 with x1.

x31

Dummy for x3 = 1.

x42

Dummy for x4 = 2.

x43

Dummy for x4 = 3.

x44

Dummy for x4 = 4.

group

Group (1–6), sample sizes: 500, 300, 100, 50, 50, 50.

Details

This data set was generated with 1050 samples, using regression coefficients (0.15, -0.15, 0.3, 0.1, -0.1, 0.3). Event times were drawn from a Weibull distribution (shape = 0.8, scale = 0.3), and censoring times from a uniform distribution with maximum 3.2.

Examples

head(sim)
#>   id      time status          x1         x2 x31 x42 x43 x44 group
#> 1  1 0.8848347      0 -0.52991001 -0.4802164   1   0   0   1     1
#> 2  2 0.3341817      0  0.01587956  0.2802364   1   1   0   0     1
#> 3  3 0.8320551      0 -0.07590612 -1.2715045   1   0   0   0     1
#> 4  4 0.2310351      1 -0.13442565  2.7067387   1   0   1   0     1
#> 5  5 0.6689048      0 -0.20878933  0.7401047   0   0   0   0     1
#> 6  6 1.1612095      0 -0.51286613 -0.8100994   1   0   0   1     1
